Hi I'm taking a look for possibly using in for my Masters project,
which  n=
eeds evolving the architecture for a neural net for a real
world applicatio=
n. 
I have read some of Ken Stanley's papers on the web but beyond that
I'm=
 a beginner, so if I may ask some beginner's questions:
1) I think my neura=
l net may be evolved using GAs , but fine tuned to
optimise using standard =
BP (ie hybrid approach). Has anybody else been
down that path using NEAT, t=
aking e.g. the weights evolved using NEAT
& feeding them into some standard=
 BP software?
2) Has NEAT been used in any 'real world'/industrial applicat=
ions yet?

and a 'how long is a piece of string question'...

3)  As yet  h=
ave no feel for how long the evolution might take. I've
ran a few of the do=
wnloaded sample executables they seem to take quite
a while to run. My neur=
al net has 8 inputs, one output and if we guess
at a final neural net of 2 =
hidden layers with 8 nodes per layer. If we
used say a 2GHz PC doing nothin=
g else - could we guess at 7 hours
(i.e. an overnight run) to evolve or is =
it more likely to be several
days? Would appreciate any best guesses or exp=
erience on this.

Thanks in advance

Mike
